etymologies: mid 16th century (originally denoting a mounted officer in the French army): French, from gens d'armes ‘men of arms’. gendarme (sense 1) dates from the late 18th century

definitions: an armed police officer in France and other French-speaking countries

examples.text: he was hauled off by a gendarme to the police station

shortDefinitions: paramilitary police officer in France and other French-speaking countries

definitions: a rock pinnacle on a mountain, occupying and blocking an arête

examples.text: the granite pillars and gendarmes kept the sun from warming us

shortDefinitions: rock pinnacle on mountain, occupying and blocking arête
